se.jguru.nazgul.tools.codestyle.enforcer.rules

Class AbstractEnforcerRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • se.jguru.nazgul.tools.codestyle.enforcer.rules.AbstractEnforcerRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.apache.maven.enforcer.rule.api.EnforcerRule
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractNonCacheableEnforcerRule

    public abstract class AbstractEnforcerRule
extends Object
implements org.apache.maven.enforcer.rule.api.EnforcerRule
    Abstract Enforcer rule specification, handling some pretty printing of exceptions.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public final void execute(org.apache.maven.enforcer.rule.api.EnforcerRuleHelper helper)
                   throws org.apache.maven.enforcer.rule.api.EnforcerRuleException
        This is the interface into the rule. This method should throw an exception containing a reason message if the rule fails the check. The plugin will then decide based on the fail flag if it should stop or just log the message as a warning.
        Specified by:
        execute in interface org.apache.maven.enforcer.rule.api.EnforcerRule
        Parameters:
        helper - The helper provides access to the log, MavenSession and has helpers to get common components. It is also able to lookup components by class name.
        Throws:
        org.apache.maven.enforcer.rule.api.EnforcerRuleException - the enforcer rule exception

      • performValidation

        protected abstract void performValidation(org.apache.maven.project.MavenProject project,
                                          org.apache.maven.enforcer.rule.api.EnforcerRuleHelper helper)
                                   throws RuleFailureException
        Delegate method, implemented by concrete subclasses.
        Parameters:
        project - The active MavenProject.
        helper - The EnforcerRuleHelper instance, from which the MavenProject has been retrieved.
        Throws:
        RuleFailureException - If the enforcer rule was not satisfied.

      • getShortRuleDescription

        protected abstract String getShortRuleDescription()
        Returns:
        A human-readable short description for this AbstractEnforcerRule. (Example: "No -impl dependencies permitted in this project")

      • isCacheable

        public boolean isCacheable()
        This method tells the enforcer if the rule results may be cached. If the result is true, the results will be remembered for future executions in the same build (ie children). Subsequent iterations of the rule will be queried to see if they are also cacheable. This will allow the rule to be uncached further down the tree if needed.
        Specified by:
        isCacheable in interface org.apache.maven.enforcer.rule.api.EnforcerRule
        Returns:
        true if rule is cacheable

      • splice

        protected static List<String> splice(String toSplice)
        Helper method which splices the provided string into a List, separating on commas.
        Parameters:
        toSplice - The string to splice
        Returns:
        A list holding the elements of the spliced string.

      • splice2Pattern

        protected static List<Pattern> splice2Pattern(String toSplice)
                                       throws PatternSyntaxException
        Helper method which splices the provided String into a List of Pattern instances.
        Parameters:
        toSplice - The string to splice
        Returns:
        A List holding the elements of the spliced string, converted to Patterns
        Throws:
        PatternSyntaxException - if the Pattern.compile method could not compile the provided string.

      • matches

        protected static boolean matches(String toMatch,
                                 List<Pattern> patternList)
        Matches the provided toMatch string with all Patterns in the patternList. If one pattern matches, this method returns true.
        Parameters:
        toMatch - The string to match to every Pattern in the supplied patternList.
        patternList - The List of Patterns to use in matching.
        Returns:
        true if one pattern in the patternList matches, this method returns true.

      • containsPrefix

        protected static boolean containsPrefix(List<String> source,
                                        String toCheck)
        Checks if any element within source startsWith the provided toCheck string.
        Parameters:
        source - The list of strings which could possibly contain toCheck.
        toCheck - The string to validate.
        Returns:
        true if any element within source returns true to toCheck.startsWith(element).
